cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi E of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly turning north then northeast, tracking toward the Mississippi–Alabama Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama border (around Biloxi, MS)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River westward to Grand Isle LA, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with higher gusts possible Tuesday through Wednesday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Peak surge 4–7 ft possible at the mouth of the Mississippi River with 2–4 ft into Lake Pontchartrain, posing flooding risk to the port area
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches of rain possible, creating a high threat of flash and urban flooding around New Orleans
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous rip currents, and prolonged river flooding potential
